definition: marked by calm self-control especially in trying circumstances; originally AAVE, great coolness and composure under strain, to loose heat
details:
adjective
- marked by calm self-control especially in trying circumstances; originally AAVE
= example: marked by calm self-control especially in trying circumstances; originally AAVE
= synonyms: coolheaded, nerveless
- fashionable and attractive at the time
- (used of a number or sum) without exaggeration or qualification
= example: (used of a number or sum) without exaggeration or qualification
- neither warm nor very cold
- psychologically cool and unenthusiastic
- (color) inducing the impression of coolness
noun
- great coolness and composure under strain
= example: great coolness and composure under strain
= synonyms: aplomb, assuredness, poise, sang-froid
- the quality of being at a refreshingly low temperature
= example: the quality of being at a refreshingly low temperature
verb
- to loose heat
= example: to loose heat
= synonyms: chill, cool down
- to lose intensity
= example: to lose intensity
= synonyms: cool down, cool off
- to make cool or cooler
= synonyms: chill, cool down
